item.title: 扎克伯格咄咄逼人地重返政治辩论，提高了 Meta 的风险
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）将关注马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返白宫之际，决定将自己推回美国政治辩论的话题。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner looks at Mark Zuckerberg’s decision to thrust himself back into the US political debate as Donald Trump returns to the White House.】

item.title: 这 10 家国防科技初创企业值得关注
item.description:
凭借高超音速飞机和庞大的无人机工厂，从 Anduril 到 Astranis 等初创公司正准备改变战争的本质。【原文：

With hypersonic planes and sprawling drone factories, startups from Anduril to Astranis are poised to change the nature of war.

】

item.title: 美国贸易代表戴志乐呼吁就贸易问题展开更深入的讨论
item.description: 过去四年来，凯瑟琳-戴一直是美国贸易政策的代言人，她奔走于世界各地，就协议进行谈判，以增强国内供应链的弹性和更广泛的经济。【原文：Katherine Tai has been the face of US trade policy for the past four years, traversing the world to negotiate agreements to bolster domestic supply-chain resiliency and the broader economy.】

item.title: 通胀回旋再次改变美联储利率走势
item.description: 我是纽约的编辑莫莉-史密斯。今天我们关注美国的通货膨胀。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Molly Smith, an editor in New York. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: Janus Henderson 分析师将英国中型股 Harworth 视为人工智能游戏
item.description: 杰纳斯-亨德森公司（Janus Henderson）的一位分析师认为，土地和房地产再生商哈沃斯集团公司（Harworth Group Plc）是 "英国房地产界最隐秘的公司之一"，该分析师称该公司股票具有人工智能风险。【原文：Land and property regenerator Harworth Group Plc is “one of the best kept secrets in UK real estate,” according to a Janus Henderson analyst who says the stock offers artificial intelligence exposure.】

item.title: 贝森特的平衡行动即将开始
item.description: 这位前对冲基金经理将告诉参议员们，"至关重要的是，我们必须确保美元仍然是世界储备货币"。【原文：Does the Trump administration want a strong or weak dollar?That’s a question being thrust back into the spotlight as Bessent prepares to face Washington lawmakers today.The former hedge fund manager will tell senators that “critically, we must ensure that the US dollar remains the world’s reserve currency,” according to remarks released before the testimony.】

item.title: 塔吉特因服装和玩具假日销售增长而上调业绩展望
item.description: 塔吉特公司（Target Corp.）在假日季销售好于预期的情况下，上调了销售指导，为公司的扭亏为盈提供了支持。【原文：Target Corp. raised its sales guidance following a better-than-expected holiday season, bolstering the company’s turnaround efforts.】

item.title: 南非举行会谈避免安赛乐米塔尔关闭工厂
item.description: 南非贸易部长帕克斯-陶（Parks Tau）表示，南非官员正在努力阻止安赛乐米塔尔公司（ArcelorMittal SA）在当地运营的一些钢厂在本月关闭，并表示他对成功抱有希望。【原文：South African officials are working to prevent the closure of some steel mills operated by the local unit of ArcelorMittal SA this month, Trade Minister Parks Tau said, adding he is hopeful about success.】

item.title: 环球银行斥资 5.6 亿美元收购墨西哥股份
item.description: 美国征信机构全美征信公司（TransUnion）签署了一项价值 5.6 亿美元的协议，增持墨西哥一家信用评分提供商的股份。【原文：US credit bureau TransUnion has signed a $560 million deal to increase its stake in a Mexico credit score provider.】

item.title: 爱立信首席执行官称欧盟需要放松管制才能跟上特朗普的步伐
item.description: 爱立信公司（Ericsson AB）总裁敦促欧洲政界人士削减技术和电信领域的繁文缛节，以避免与美国的差距不断扩大。【原文：Ericsson AB’s head urged European politicians to cut red tape in the technology and telecommunications sectors to avoid a widening gap with the US that he said will likely get worse under incoming US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 企业向达沃斯精英推介南非增长的转机
item.description: 南非商界看到了国家经济困境正在好转的迹象，并将在下周的世界经济论坛上传达这一信息。【原文：South Africa’s business community is seeing evidence that the nation’s struggling economy is turning around and will take that message to the World Economic Forum next week.】

item.title: 奥地利极右翼在 64 亿欧元储蓄计划中瞄准气候问题
item.description: 试图组建民族主义保守派政府的奥地利谈判代表计划削减约五分之一与气候保护相关的补贴，以避免受到欧盟的预算谴责。【原文：Austrian negotiators trying to form a nationalist-conservative government plan to cut about a fifth of all subsidies related to climate protection in an attempt to avoid the European Union’s budget reprimand.】

item.title: Insight Partners 为新旗舰基金融资 125 亿美元
item.description:
该公司将最初的筹资目标从 200 亿美元下调。【原文：

The firm reduced its initial fundraising target from $20 billion. 

】

item.title: 沙特上市成为海湾地区 IPO 热潮的焦点
item.description: 在中东地区最近一连串的股票销售中，沙特阿拉伯的首次公开募股表现抢眼。【原文：Initial public offerings from Saudi Arabia have been the star performers in a string of recent share sales in the Middle East, where some high profile regional listings have had tepid debuts in the last few months.】

item.title: 海峡时报》报道：新加坡 "不反对 "采取更多房地产降温措施
item.description: 海峡时报》援引新加坡国家发展部部长李德颂的话报道说，新加坡政府 "不反对 "在必要时采取更多房地产降温措施。【原文：Singapore’s government is “not averse” to implementing more property cooling measures if needed, the Straits Times newspaper reported, citing Minister for National Development Desmond Lee.】

item.title: 英国石油公司首席执行官表示，为削减成本将裁员数千人
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）首席执行官穆雷-奥金克斯（Murray Auchincloss）周四告诉员工，该公司正在裁减 4700 个内部职位和 3000 个承包商职位，这家总部位于伦敦的能源巨头正在努力降低成本。【原文：BP Plc is cutting 4,700 positions internally and 3,000 contractor jobs, Chief Executive Officer Murray Auchincloss told staff on Thursday, as the London-based energy giant seeks to reduce costs.】

item.title: 为什么说美国对俄罗斯石油的最新制裁是件大事？
item.description: 在乔-拜登（Joe Biden）担任总统的最后几天，美国公布了其迄今为止最全面、最积极的努力，以切断帮助俄罗斯资助其乌克兰战争的石油运输。【原文：In the final days of Joe Biden’s presidency, the US unveiled its most sweeping and aggressive effort yet to disrupt the oil shipments that are helping Russia to fund its war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 制裁之后，向中国运输俄罗斯 ESPO 石油的成本增加了三倍
item.description: 据交易商称，上周美国对莫斯科石油业实施严厉制裁后，俄罗斯ESPO原油运往中国的成本增加了两倍多，预计运费还会更高。【原文：The cost of shipping Russian ESPO crude to China has more than tripled after the US imposed aggressive sanctions on Moscow’s oil industry last week, with rates expected to climb even higher, according to traders.】

item.title: 英国 "即买即付 "市场在紧缩年到来前蓬勃发展
item.description: 从苹果 iPhone 到阿迪达斯鞋和 Uber Eats 外卖，英国人正前所未有地使用 "即买即付 "的方式为自己的生活方式提供资金。【原文：From Apple iPhones to Adidas shoes and Uber Eats takeaways, Britons are using buy-now, pay-later like never before to fund their lifestyles.】

item.title: 英格兰银行调查显示：贷款人预计 2025 年初抵押贷款需求将萎缩
item.description: 一项对银行和房屋建筑协会的调查显示，预计 2025 年初购房者对抵押贷款的需求将有所回落。【原文：Demand for mortgages from home buyers is expected to fall back in early 2025, according to a survey of banks and building societies.】

item.title: 因 IT 服务需求增长，Infosys 上调销售额预期
item.description: Infosys Ltd. 本财年第三次上调了年度销售额预期，从而提振了企业信息技术支出复苏的希望。【原文：Infosys Ltd. raised its annual sales forecast for the third time this fiscal year, boosting hopes of a revival in corporations’ spending on information technology.】

item.title: 据说印度央行将酝酿更大胆的措施来缓解现金紧张状况
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度央行可能会采取更强有力的措施，包括降低贷款机构的现金储备要求，以缓解流动性紧张的状况。【原文：India’s central bank may take stronger measures, including cutting cash reserve requirement for lenders, to ease tight liquidity conditions, according to people familiar with the developments.】

item.title: KKR 投资奥地利农业科技公司 SmaXtec
item.description: KKR & Co.投资了农业技术公司 smaXtec，这家私募股权公司将继续推进成长型融资。【原文：KKR & Co. has invested in agricultural technology company smaXtec as the private equity firm continues to push into growth funding.】

item.title: 2024 年，战争将吞噬俄罗斯近四分之一的流动资产
item.description: 去年，俄罗斯花费了近四分之一的国家财富基金可用储备，以维持经济的战争状态，并为入侵乌克兰提供资金。【原文：Russia spent almost a quarter of the national wealth fund’s available reserves last year to keep the economy on a war footing and finance its invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 香港嘉道理筹集 5000 万美元提升城市形象
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港亿万富翁迈克尔-嘉道理（Michael Kadoorie）已与投资者接洽，希望筹集至少 5000 万美元（约合 3.89 亿港元）的资金，用于提升香港的城市形象。【原文：Hong Kong billionaire Michael Kadoorie has approached investors to raise at least $50 million (HK$389 million) to fund efforts to boost the city’s image, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 一月份对英国来说只是 "短暂的疯狂期 "吗？
item.description:
经济学家吉姆-奥尼尔（Jim O'Neill）告诉《In the City》，英国市场的波动被夸大了，但工党仍需说服投资者其计划是合理的。【原文：

Economist Jim O’Neill tells In the City that UK market moves have been exaggerated, but Labour still needs to convince investors its plans are sound.

】

item.title: 香港机场将游艇和艺术视为旅游业的下一个增长点
item.description: 作为世界上最繁忙的交通枢纽之一，香港国际机场正在寻求投资者，为包括两个游艇码头在内的 1,000 亿港元（合 128 亿美元）扩建工程的大部分资金提供支持，以提高机场的客流量。【原文：Hong Kong International Airport is seeking investors to fund the majority of a HK$100 billion ($12.8 billion) expansion, which includes two marinas, as one of the world’s busiest transit hubs looks to boost visitation.】

item.title: Blackstone 私人信贷基金开始赢得欧洲富人的青睐
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 面向高净值个人的欧洲私人信贷基金 ECRED 到月底将达到 15 亿欧元（15.3 亿美元），比去年激增三倍。【原文：Blackstone Inc.’s European private credit fund for high net-worth individuals, ECRED, is set to reach €1.5 billion ($1.53 billion) by month’s end, a threefold surge over the past year.】

item.title: 捷克电力公司计划对 7.35 亿美元债务进行绿色再融资
item.description: 总部位于捷克的 Energo-Pro AS 公司希望利用绿色票据为即将到期的 7.35 亿美元债务提前再融资，以实现其横跨几大洲的水电站投资组合的多样化。【原文：Czech-based Energo-Pro AS is hoping to refinance $735 million of upcoming debt maturities early with green notes as it seeks to diversify its portfolio of hydro power plants spanning several continents.】

item.title: 沃尔格林用智能屏幕替换冰箱门。现在已造成 2 亿美元的损失
item.description:
一家初创公司向连锁药店承诺，其高科技冷藏箱将跟踪购物者，并引发一场店内广告革命。【原文：

A startup promised the pharmacy chain its high-tech coolers would track shoppers and spark an in-store ad revolution.

】
